description: Request for funds included subject 'Testnet' when agent actually needed Mainnet ETH. Caused confusion and delay.
context: Agent messaged collaborator asking for 'Base ETH for testing'. Subject line said 'Testnet'. Collaborator sent Sepolia testnet ETH. Agent actually needed mainnet for 0xSplits deployment.

original_message.subject: Quick Testnet Favor
original_message.body: Could you send a bit of Base ETH for testing?

better_message.subject: Base MAINNET ETH for 0xSplits Deploy
better_message.body: Need 0.001 ETH on Base mainnet for 0xSplits contract deployment. Wallet: 0x643fc612... Will be used for immutable split contract.

reproduction:
1. Send vague funding request
2. Observe recipient guesses wrong intent
3. Spend time clarifying
4. Retry with specific: amount, network (MAINNET/TESTNET), wallet, purpose
notes: Vague asks get vague responses. Include: exact amount, chain (explicitly mainnet/testnet), wallet address, what happens next. Subject line is often the only thing people read.
